sen.j: 久我志通（こが ふみみち、文化 (日本)7年（1810年）‐文政元年（1818年））は、江戸時代後期の廷臣。
sen.e: Humimichi KOGA (1810 - 1818) was a retainer of Imperial Court who lived in the latter half of the Edo period.
Humimichi KOGA (1810 - 1818) was a retainer of Imperial Court who lived during the latter half of the Edo period.
Fumimichi KOGA (1810 - 1818) was a retainer of Imperial Court who lived during the latter half of the Edo period.
He became jiju (a chamberlain) at the rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
He became jiju (chamberlain) at the rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior 4th Rank, Lower Grade).
He became jiju (chamberlain) at the rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
His father was Michiaki KOGA, Naidaijin (minister of the Interior).
His father was Michiaki KOGA, Naidaijin (minister of the Interior).
His father was Michiaki KOGA, Naidaijin (minister of the Interior).

sen.j: 母は熊本藩主細川治年の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Harutoshi HOSOKAWA, the lord of the Kumamoto domain.
His mother was the daughter of Harutoshi HOSOKAWA, lord of the Kumamoto domain.
His mother was the daughter of Harutoshi HOSOKAWA, lord of the Kumamoto Domain.
He died young, at the age of nine.
He died young, at the age of nine.
He died young, at the age of nine.

sen.j: 一条家からの養子久我建通が久我家の名跡を継いだ。
sen.e: Takemichi KOGA, the son adopted from the Ichijo family, inherited the line of the Kuga family.
Takemichi KOGA, the son adopted from the Ichijo family, inherited the line of the Kuga family.
Takemichi KOGA, the son adopted from the Ichijo family, inherited the line of the Koga family.
